import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
import seaborn as sns
from io import BytesIO
import base64

plt.style.use('seaborn')
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))
sns.set_palette('husl')

x = np.arange(len(['Point 1', 'Point 2', 'Point 4', 'Point 5', 'Point 7', 'Point 8', 'Point 10', 'Point 11']))
y = [1.0, 1.0, 2.0, 2.5, 3.0, 4.0, 4.0, 6.0]
ax.fill_between(x, y, alpha=0.3)
ax.plot(x, y, linewidth=2)
ax.set_xticks(x)
ax.set_xticklabels(['Point 1', 'Point 2', 'Point 4', 'Point 5', 'Point 7', 'Point 8', 'Point 10', 'Point 11'], rotation=45, ha='right')
ax.set_xlabel('Categories')
ax.set_ylabel('Values')
ax.grid(True, alpha=0.3)

plt.title('Cumulative Revenue', fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')
plt.tight_layout()

# Save to base64
buffer = BytesIO()
plt.savefig(buffer, format='png', dpi=100)
buffer.seek(0)
image_base64 = base64.b64encode(buffer.read()).decode()
plt.close()
print(image_base64)
description: Data extracted from user request for Cumulative Revenue showing an upward trend from 1.00 to 6.00
insights: Peak at Point 11 (6.00), lowest at Point 1 (1.00)
